metadata.synopsis: Several disparate characters find themselves in a low-end Bangkok hotel. There is Sean (Jonathan Rhys-Meyers), a drug dealer awaiting a delivery; a psychologist named Rosa (Saskia Reeves), who is in mourning; a female assassin; and an up-and-coming Mafia boss trying to make a name for himself. Their pasts are revealed through a set of flashbacks, but an act of theft committed by Wit (Alexander Rendel), a bellboy, will affect each of their futures.

reviews: Never seems to get on a coherent meaningful track.
what could have been a deep and introspective movie becomes a follow-the-stolen-drugs-through-the-crowded-streets action flick
